claim:
We used descriptive statistics to summarize trends by decade and discipline.Results
Our search identified 26,487 citations (Fig 1).
title: Fig 1. Flow diagram of identifying, screening, assessing, and including studies.
caption: This figure shows the number of articles identified, screened, assessed, and included as part of the literature search process.

claim: This trend is likely to continue in the 2020s: nearly a third (32.5%) of all published articles (n = 6,454) appeared in the first 2.5 years of the current decade (Fig 2).
title: Fig 2. Number of published Delphi articles by decade.
caption: This figure shows the number and percent of Delphi articles published in each decade, starting from 1960.

claim: The remaining 4.4% (n = 879) appeared in other fields such as arts, music, education, library, and military science (see Fig 3).
title: Fig 3. Number of published Delphi articles by discipline.
caption: This figure shows the number and percent of Delphi articles published by discipline, including medicine, science and technology, social sciences, and other, separately for Delphi application and methodological articles, as well as combined.

claim: While there were no Delphi publications in medical journals in the 1960s and only 16.4% of all Delphi articles published in the 1970s appeared in medical journals, this proportion increased to 39.7% in the 1980s (Fig 4).
title: Fig 4. Number of published Delphi articles by decade and discipline.
caption: This figure shows the number and percent of Delphi articles published by discipline, including medicine, science and technology, social sciences, and other, in each decade, starting from the 1960s.

title: Fig 1. Flow diagram of identifying, screening, assessing, and including studies.
caption: This figure shows the number of articles identified, screened, assessed, and included as part of the literature search process.
